import React, { useState }from 'react' import Button from 'react-bootstrap/Button' import Collapse from 'react-bootstrap/Collapse' import parse from 'html-react-parser'; // const parser = require('html-react-parser'); export default function Instruction() { const questions = [ "What is Conway's Game of Life?", "What are the rules of the game?" ] const answers = [ '

The Game of Life is a cellular-automaton,\ zero player game, developed by John Conway in 1970.\ The game is played on an infinite grid of square cells,\ and its evolution is only determined by its initial state.\

\

reference: \ \ http://web.mit.edu/sp.268/www/2010/lifeSlides.pdf

', "

Life has 4 simple rules:

\
    \
  1. A living cell with less than two living neighbours dies.
    2. \
  2. A living cell with two or three live neighbours lives.
    3. \
  3. A living cell with more than three live neighbours dies.
    4. \
  4. A dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
    5. \
" ] const initialOpens = [] for (let i=0; i < answers.length; i++) { initialOpens.push(false) } const [opens, setOpens] = useState(initialOpens) // const [open1, setOpen1] = useState(false); // const [open2, setOpen2] = useState(false); return (

Life has 4 simple rules:

  1. A living cell with less than two living neighbours dies.
  2. A living cell with two or three live neighbours lives.
  3. A living cell with more than three live neighbours dies.
  4. A dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
) }
